msDesc.head:
Letter from
John Gibson Lockhart
to Maria Edgeworth, , July 30. 1842

div.p:
After
sundry vain attempts to see
Mr Bentley I wrote to him on
the subject of your last letter &
I enclose his tardy answer
which will not perhaps appear
a very satisfactory one. Alas!
I fear I have exhausted my
small powers on this occasion
- but at any rate I shall be
glad to be told the result. The
book trade has long been in
a wretched condition - that
I am sure every literary
person will attest - and
until we see a general
revival I fear there is no

chance of a beneficial change
in this department. The numbers
of cases of distress that come
across me are most grievous,
- overproduction has ruined this
like other manufactures and it
at least looks very much as if
machinery had interfered fatally
with the labour of the intellectual
animal. Thank you for
your news of Mr Wilson - I was
much an invalid when one
of yryour brothers was good enough to
call here otherwise I shdshould have
found him out - but I hope he
is there be with you when you delight

in by reappearing here in Novr
Your kind messages affair shall
not be kept from Charlotte &
Miss Watkins. They have been
bathing at Scarborough for
some weeks & removed a day
or two ago to Rokeby where I
hope to join them by & bye. My
tall boy is also there, shooting
rabbits & so forth, in anticipation
of being allowed to attack
the grouse farther to the North
in September. They are all
well & happy.
I had not observed Sir Arhd
Alison's furious puff of
Miladi Londonderry. Her

little sketches of Russia - mere
trifles - chiefly descriptions of
ladies' dresses - were printed
3 or 4 years ago in one of the
Annuals - but which I can't
say. I remember thinking
them better than her Lord's
"Narratives" - but not being
at all sure that either Lord
or Lady had had much hand
in what came forth under
their august names, I
did not study it carefully as
the Historian. After all the
Moscow described by Lady L
could be that wwith which he had
to do.
div.closer:
Ever Most truly yours
J G Lockhart
